title: Farmers Market brings people and food in from the cold | Video | kimt.com
text: Farmers Market brings people and food in from the cold The Rochester farmers market had its first 2024 indoor market of the year and despite the cold people came to support locally grown food. Kimt News 3's Maureen Dudley went to the market to see what was being grown and the farmers were present at the market. Weather Alert ...Drifting Snow and Slick Travel for Some Followed by Bitter Cold... .Light snow continues this evening with gusty winds leading to some drifting across roadways, particularly across open areas of southeast Minnesota, northeast Iowa and far southwest Wisconsin. Bitterly cold air impacts the region tonight into the start of the new week with wind chill values of 25 to 40 degrees below zero. Limit time outdoors, if possible. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Iowa and southeast Minnesota. * WHEN...Until noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. && Currently in Rochester -9°F Haze 8°F / -9°F 3 AM -9°F 4 AM -9°F 5 AM -9°F 6 AM -9°F 7 AM -9°F Online Poll © Copyright 2024 [Allen Media Broadcasting](https://allenmediabroadcasting.com/), 1751 Hwy 52 N., Rochester, MN | [Terms of Use](/site/terms.html)| [Privacy Policy](/site/privacy.html) Powered by
